workflow.name: Generate product videos automatically with Gemini, FAL and Google Workspace
workflow.description:
## üìÑ What this workflow does
 This workflow turns your n8n into an automated product-video generator powered by Google Sheets. When a new row is added with status = run, it:

- Downloads the product image from Google Drive.
- Converts the image to base64 and sends it to Gemini, which creates a branded ad-style variant.
- Saves the generated image back into a designated Google Drive folder.
- Sends the image to FAL (image-to-video) to generate a short promotional video clip.
- Polls FAL‚Äôs response_url until the video is ready.
- Uploads the video to Google Drive (videos folder).
- Updates the original Google Sheet row with the video link and sets status = finished.
- Handles API latency via wait/polling and logs failures into the sheet if needed.


## üë§ Who is this for
- Marketing teams automating creative asset production.
- E-commerce businesses needing quick product promo videos.
- Agencies creating branded ad content at scale.


## ‚úÖ Requirements
- An n8n instance.
- A Google Sheet with at least these columns: STT, link_image, note, status, link_video.
- Google Sheets & Google Drive OAuth2 credentials connected in n8n.
- Gemini API key (for ad-style image generation).
- FAL API key (for image-to-video).


‚öôÔ∏è How to set up
1. Import the provided workflow JSON into n8n.
2. Connect Google Sheets credentials and point to your sheet (documentId + gid).
3. Connect Google Drive credentials and update folder IDs in the two Upload File nodes (images/videos).
4. Add Gemini and FAL API keys in the respective HTTP Request headers (via Credentials).
5. Test: add a row with link_image, note, and status = run. The workflow should generate and save a video, then update the sheet with the link.


üîÅ How it works
- Trigger ‚Üí Google Sheets Trigger fires on rowAdded where status = run.
- Pre-processing ‚Üí Download the product image from Google Drive ‚Üí extract base64.
- LLM Image Generation ‚Üí Gemini generates an ad-style variant based on note.
- Storage ‚Üí Upload the generated image into the ‚Äúimages‚Äù Drive folder.
- Video Creation ‚Üí FAL converts the branded image into a short video.
- Polling ‚Üí Wait node + HTTP Request check job status until video is completed.
- Write-back ‚Üí Upload final video into the ‚Äúvideos‚Äù Drive folder, update the sheet with the link_video, and set status = finished.

parameters.content:
## Workflow Overview
**Purpose:** Auto-generate branded product/ad videos directly from Google Sheets rows.
**Trigger:** A new row is added with an image link (Google Sheets Trigger - rowAdded).
**Steps:**
1) Download image from Google Drive ‚Üí Extract base64.
2) Call Gemini API to create an ad-style image variant.
3) Convert & upload the generated image to Drive (images folder).
4) Send the image to FAL (image-to-video) to create a short clip.
5) Poll FAL response URL until status = completed, then download the video.
6) Upload video to Drive (videos folder) and update the sheet with the video link.

**Result:** A fully automated pipeline: a spreadsheet row ‚Üí final video asset.

## Setup Checklist
- APIs & Keys: Google Sheets, Google Drive, **Gemini API key**, **FAL API key** (use Credentials; do not hardcode).
- Google Drive: set folder IDs in the two **Upload file** nodes (image/video destinations).
- Sheet columns (minimum): `STT`, `link_image`, `link_video`, `status`, `note`.
- Trigger: runs when a new row is added.
- Quick Test: add a row with a valid `link_image` ‚Üí image generated ‚Üí video uploaded ‚Üí `link_video` written back.

## Notes & Tips
- Security: keep `x-goog-api-key` and FAL `Authorization` in Credentials (`{{$credentials...}}`).
- Polling: FAL is async; poll `response_url` until `status == completed` before downloading the video.
- Links: if an API needs a direct file URL, use Drive direct-download (`uc?export=download&id=<FILE_ID>`).
- Prompts: tweak Gemini text for brand voice; change FAL `prompt` (e.g., replace "slow moving").
- Error Handling: add `If` + `Wait` + retries; log failures to the sheet (`status`, `note`).
- Scale: paste multiple rows to batch-generate creatives.

data.details: The Filter node can be used to filter items based on a condition. If the condition is met, the item will be passed on to the next node. If the condition is not met, the item will be omitted. Conditions can be combined together by AND(meet all conditions), or OR(meet at least one condition).
